newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore small firms to get Millennium grants.
newsitem.headline: Singapore small firms to get Millennium grants.

text.p: Singapore's small and medium-sized firms (SMEs) can get grants for half of the cost of consultancy services to rectify Millennium computer problems, the National Computer Board (NCB) said on Thursday.

The scheme was announced at an NCB seminar on financial and legal issues related to 2000. It is an extension of the Local Enterprise Computerisation Programme (LECP) which helps SMEs in their use of information technology.
NCB said in a statement that companies which submit applications before December 31 would get a higher grant of up to 70 percent of the cost of consultancy services.
The scope of consultancy includes impact analysis, evaluation and recommendations of solutions, project planning and management.
A company is considered an SME under the LECP scheme if it is registered in Singapore and has at least 30 percent equity owned by a Singaporean or a permanent resident.
It must also have fixed productive assets not exceeding Singapore $15 million and employ up to 200 staff.
The Millenium bug is caused by dates in computer systems which are programmed in a two-digit field which will turn to "00" in 2000 causing errors to occur as it could be read as 1900.
